page.title: 05Nant Glandulais Stream
page.content: This is a study of a small stream,over approximately half a mile of its length,flowing roughly in a North-South direction,but with many twists and turns.On a normal day,the depth varies between 380mm in the deepest part and 20mm over a man made weir.After very heavy rain the stream becomes a dangerous,fast moving torrent,breaking its bank in places,Flowing through many culverts,it enters a man made lake before flowing into the river Rhymney and thence the sea.The lake is popular with fishermen and a variety of fish are caught there including tench,perch,carp and rudd. Flora:Plants found in the stream and on the water's edge included a variety of rushes,flag iris,bur-reed,lesser duckweed,water lily,starwort,
